TITLE: You may get a 1099-K for Venmo and PayPal payments. Here's how to prepare — and shrink your tax bill
SUMMARY: If you've received payments via third-party networks such as Venmo or PayPal, you may get a Form 1099-K. Here's how to prepare and reduce your tax liability.

TITLE: Congress may revisit the expanded child tax credit in the lame duck session. But terms may not be as generous as in 2021
SUMMARY: As Congress races to get as much done as possible before a new session begins, it may consider reupping the expanded child tax credit.

TITLE: These are the best 10 metro areas for first-time home buyers — and how to make it more affordable no matter where you’re buying
SUMMARY: Certain markets have become more appealing for first-time home buyers in 2023, according to a Zillow report. Here's what to know.

TITLE: Here are some things to think about before deciding to retire in another state
SUMMARY: A United Van Lines study found the percentage of people retiring to a new state grew to 18.3% in 2021.Moving is not a straightforward decision, however.

TITLE: Boomers have more wealth ‘than any other generation,’ but millennials may not inherit as much as they hope
SUMMARY: There's a growing disconnect between how much millennials expect to inherit and how much aging baby boomers plan on leaving them.

TITLE: Santa Claus rallies are a 'meaningful' trend, says financial advisor: What one could mean for investors this year
SUMMARY: Stocks have been positive about in roughly 3 of 4 holiday seasons going back several decades. The reason isn't exactly clear.

TITLE: 360,000 student loan borrowers received $24 billion in forgiveness from fix to Public Service Loan Forgiveness
SUMMARY: The Biden administration's fix to the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program has benefited hundreds of thousands of borrowers. More relief is on the way.

TITLE: Long Covid is distorting the labor market — and that's bad for the U.S. economy
SUMMARY: Millions of people may be out of work, cutting hours or changing the nature of their jobs due to long Covid. The dynamics pose headwinds to the U.S. economy.

TITLE: Long Covid's financial devastation: $8,000 in credit card debt, ruined retirement plans
SUMMARY: On top of the toll it takes on their health, long Covid patients report a devastating impact on finances, including massive medical expenses and job losses.

TITLE: 401(k) 'hardship' withdrawals hit record high, Vanguard says — another sign households feel the pinch of inflation
SUMMARY: 401(k) savers are raiding their nest eggs due to financial hardship at elevated rates, suggesting they need fast cash amid quickly rising consumer prices.

TITLE: Amid inflation and market volatility, just 12% of adults — and 29% of millionaires — feel 'wealthy'
SUMMARY: These days, only 12% of Americans consider themselves wealthy, including just 29% of millionaires.

TITLE: Taking required minimum distributions? How to reduce the sting of selling in a down market
SUMMARY: The deadline is approaching for required minimum distributions, and retirees need to be careful when withdrawing money in a down market. Here's what to know.

TITLE: 50% of women say they are behind on retirement savings. Here's why they face challenges
SUMMARY: Women face higher hurdles for how much income they will need in retirement, and they lack confidence they can clear them, according to a Goldman Sachs report.

TITLE: 'Risky behaviors' are causing credit scores to level off — here's how that can hurt you
SUMMARY: Your three-digit credit score can determine the interest rate you’ll pay for credit cards, car loans and mortgages. The higher your score, the lower the rate.

TITLE: It's never too soon to save for retirement. Here are 3 ways Gen Z workers can start now
SUMMARY: With many older workers and retirees regretting not saving earlier in life, it's never too soon for new college graduates to start socking away money.

TITLE: 'It's possible the market can rally': Financial advisors say a recession isn't inevitable
SUMMARY: The CEOs of some of the biggest American companies believe the economy may be heading for a recession. There's still hope for investors, financial advisors say.

TITLE: Despite economic uncertainty, it’s a ‘great moment’ for dollar-cost averaging, says Betterment CEO
SUMMARY: Despite economic uncertainty, experts at CNBC's Financial Advisor Summit urge investors to stay in the market in 2023. Here's what to know.

TITLE: 4 financial moves if you have — or are worried about — long Covid
SUMMARY: Households can manage or plan for the financial impact of long Covid via insurance, health, tax and estate planning.

TITLE: Fed policymakers will see 'they blew it' with interest rate hikes, predicts Starwood Capital's Barry Sternlicht
SUMMARY: The CEO of the private investment firm said during CNBC's Financial Advisor Summit on Tuesday that there's no question that the U.S. is headed for recession.

TITLE: Social media financial content is a 'Wild West.' Here are the red flags to watch out for before investing your money
SUMMARY: While social media content creators may tout all-or-nothing or get-rich-quick schemes, you may want to do a gut check before you invest.

TITLE: Op-ed: Investors need to wait it out before snatching up software stocks
SUMMARY: On the surface, it looks like it could be time to buy segments of the market, like software, that took a beating throughout much of 2022. But perhaps not yet.

TITLE: Robinhood to pay a 1% 'match' on customer contributions to retail individual retirement accounts
SUMMARY: The retail brokerage will match 1% of each dollar saved in its individual retirement accounts. Experts think it's a way to get attention in a crowded market.

TITLE: 'You can control your tax-reporting destiny.' 4 key year-end tax moves
SUMMARY: While your tax return isn't due until April, several key deadlines are approaching by year-end, experts say. Here's what filers need to know.

TITLE: Gen Zers are coming home for the holidays on mom and dad's dime, study says
SUMMARY: About half of young adults plan to travel home this holiday season. However, many will rely on their parents to pick up the tab, according to a recent report.

TITLE: Supreme Court likely to rule that Biden student loan plan is illegal, experts say. Here's what that means for borrowers
SUMMARY: The fate of the Biden administration's student loan forgiveness plan rests with the Supreme Court. That could be bad news for borrowers, legal experts say.

TITLE: Worried about Social Security benefit cuts? Calculators can gauge how changes may affect you
SUMMARY: To get an idea of how much any retirement benefit cuts may affect you, using a reputable Social Security calculator can help.

TITLE: These 10 cars have the greatest potential lifespan — and 6 are Toyotas
SUMMARY: Most of the vehicles on the list by iSeeCars can travel a quarter-million miles or more.

TITLE: Men participate less often in 401(k) plans than women, unless they are automatically enrolled
SUMMARY: Despite having larger 401(k) account balances overall, men lag behind women when it comes to signing up for their workplace plan, research shows.

TITLE: 'A lot of people are going to see less money in their pocket.' Here are must-know tax changes for 2022
SUMMARY: There are significant changes for the 2022 tax season. Here's what taxpayers need to know.

TITLE: 'This is a crisis.' Why more workers need access to retirement savings
SUMMARY: Dreams of a comfortable retirement may elude Americans due to a lack of adequate savings. The problem may start with not having retirement plans at work.
